--- FILE: ./workflows/release.yml ---
name: Release

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [closed]
    branches:
      - main

permissions:
  contents: write
  pull-requests: write

jobs:
  release:
    name: Create Release
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    # Only run when PR is merged (not just closed)
    if: github.event.pull_request.merged == true
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
          token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Setup Git
        run: |
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"

      - name: Draft Release
        id: drafter
        uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v6
        with:
          config-name: release-drafter.yml
          publish: false  # Don't publish yet
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Extract version
        id: version
        run: |
          VERSION=$(echo "${{ steps.drafter.outputs.tag_name }}" | sed 's/v//g')
          echo "version=${VERSION}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "tag=${{ steps.drafter.outputs.tag_name }}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "ðŸ“¦ Next version: ${{ steps.drafter.outputs.tag_name }}"

      - name: Check if tag exists
        id: check_tag
        run: |
          if git rev-parse "${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo "exists=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "âš ï¸ Tag ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }} already exists"
          else
            echo "exists=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "âœ“ Tag ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }} is new"
          fi

      - name: Update version files
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}"
          
          # Create or update VERSION file
          echo "${VERSION}" > VERSION
          
          # If you have package.json
          if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
            npm version ${VERSION} --no-git-tag-version --allow-same-version
          fi
          
          # If you have other version files, add them here
          # sed -i "s/version: .*/version: ${VERSION}/" config.yaml
          
          echo "âœ“ Updated version files to ${VERSION}"

      - name: Commit version bump
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        id: commit
        run: |
          git add -A
          
          if git diff --staged --quiet; then
            echo "has_changes=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "â„¹ï¸ No version files to commit"
          else
            git commit -m "chore: bump version to ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }} [skip ci]"
            echo "has_changes=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "âœ“ Committed version bump"
          fi

      - name: Create and push tag
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        run: |
          git tag -a "${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}" -m "Release ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}"
          
          # Push commit and tag atomically
          git push origin main
          git push origin "${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}"
          
          echo "âœ“ Created and pushed tag ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}"

      - name: Publish Release
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            const release_id = '${{ steps.drafter.outputs.id }}';
            
            await github.rest.repos.updateRelease({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              release_id: release_id,
              draft: false
            });
            
            core.info('âœ“ Published release ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}');

      - name: Summary
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        run: |
          echo "## ðŸš€ Release Created" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "- **Version:** ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "- **Release URL:** ${{ steps.drafter.outputs.html_url }}" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "- **Merged PR:** #${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
--- FILE: ./workflows/pr-labeler.yml ---
name: PR Labeler

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, reopened]

permissions:
  contents: read
  pull-requests: write

jobs:
  label:
    name: Auto-label PR
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Auto-label based on branch name
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            const branch = context.payload.pull_request.head.ref;
            const labels = [];
            
            // Auto-label based on branch naming convention
            if (branch.startsWith('feature/') || branch.startsWith('feat/')) {
              labels.push('feature', 'minor');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('fix/') || branch.startsWith('bugfix/')) {
              labels.push('bug', 'patch');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('hotfix/')) {
              labels.push('bug', 'patch');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('chore/')) {
              labels.push('chore', 'patch');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('docs/')) {
              labels.push('documentation', 'patch');
            }
            
            // Add labels if any were determined
            if (labels.length > 0) {
              await github.rest.issues.addLabels({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.payload.pull_request.number,
                labels: labels
              });
              
              core.info(`âœ“ Added labels: ${labels.join(', ')}`);
            } else {
              core.warning('âš ï¸ No auto-labels determined. Please add version label (major/minor/patch) manually.');
            }

      - name: Comment on PR
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            const branch = context.payload.pull_request.head.ref;
            const body = `
            ## ðŸ·ï¸ PR Labels
            
            This PR has been automatically labeled based on the branch name: \`${branch}\`
            
            **Version Impact:**
            - \`major\`: Breaking changes (e.g., v1.0.0 â†’ v2.0.0)
            - \`minor\`: New features (e.g., v1.0.0 â†’ v1.1.0)
            - \`patch\`: Bug fixes/chores (e.g., v1.0.0 â†’ v1.0.1)
            
            If the auto-label is incorrect, please update the labels before merging.
            `;
            
            await github.rest.issues.createComment({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.payload.pull_request.number,
              body: body
            });
--- FILE: ./workflows/ci.yml ---
name: CI

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, synchronize, reopened, labeled]
    branches:
      - main
  push:
    branches:
      - main

permissions:
  contents: read
  pull-requests: read

jobs:
  # Validate PR has proper labels for versioning
  validate-labels:
    name: Validate PR Labels
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
    steps:
      - name: Wait for auto-labeler
        if: github.event.action == 'opened' || github.event.action == 'reopened'
        run: |
          echo "â³ Waiting 5 seconds for auto-labeler to complete..."
          sleep 5

      - name: Check for version label
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            // Fetch fresh PR data to get updated labels
            const { data: pr } = await github.rest.pulls.get({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              pull_number: context.issue.number
            });
            
            const labels = pr.labels.map(l => l.name);
            const versionLabels = ['major', 'minor', 'patch'];
            const hasVersionLabel = labels.some(label => versionLabels.includes(label));
            
            core.info(`Current labels: ${labels.join(', ')}`);
            
            if (!hasVersionLabel) {
              core.setFailed('âŒ PR must have one of: major, minor, or patch label');
            } else {
              const foundLabel = labels.find(l => versionLabels.includes(l));
              core.info(`âœ“ Found version label: ${foundLabel}`);
            }

  # Run your tests, linting, etc.
  test:
    name: Test & Lint
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Run tests
        run: |
          echo "âœ“ Tests placeholder - add your test commands"
          echo "Examples:"
          echo "  npm test"
          echo "  go test ./..."
          echo "  pytest"

      - name: Run linting
        run: |
          echo "âœ“ Linting placeholder - add your linting commands"
          echo "Examples:"
          echo "  npm run lint"
          echo "  golangci-lint run"
          echo "  flake8"

  # Build validation (if you have build steps)
  build:
    name: Build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [test]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Build application
        run: |
          echo "âœ“ Build placeholder - add your build commands"
          echo "Examples:"
          echo "  npm run build"
          echo "  go build"
          echo "  docker build -t myapp:${{ github.sha }} ."

  # All checks must pass before merge
  ci-success:
    name: CI Success
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [validate-labels, test, build]
    if: always()
    steps:
      - name: Check all jobs
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const needs = ${{ toJSON(needs) }};
            const failed = Object.values(needs).some(job => job.result === 'failure');
            
            if (failed) {
              core.setFailed('One or more CI jobs failed');
            } else {
              core.info('âœ“ All CI checks passed');
            }

name-template: 'v$RESOLVED_VERSION'
tag-template: 'v$RESOLVED_VERSION'

# Changelog template
change-template: '- $TITLE @$AUTHOR (#$NUMBER)'
change-title-escapes: '\<*_&'

# Categories for organizing changes
categories:
  - title: 'ðŸš€ Features'
    labels:
      - 'feature'
      - 'enhancement'
  - title: 'ðŸ› Bug Fixes'
    labels:
      - 'fix'
      - 'bugfix'
      - 'bug'
  - title: 'ðŸ“š Documentation'
    labels:
      - 'documentation'
      - 'docs'
  - title: 'ðŸ”§ Maintenance'
    labels:
      - 'chore'
      - 'dependencies'
      - 'refactor'
  - title: 'âš¡ Performance'
    labels:
      - 'performance'
      - 'optimization'

# Exclude certain changes from changelog
exclude-labels:
  - 'skip-changelog'
  - 'duplicate'
  - 'invalid'
  - 'wontfix'

# Semantic versioning resolution
version-resolver:
  major:
    labels:
      - 'major'
      - 'breaking'
      - 'breaking-change'
  minor:
    labels:
      - 'minor'
      - 'feature'
      - 'enhancement'
  patch:
    labels:
      - 'patch'
      - 'fix'
      - 'bugfix'
      - 'bug'
      - 'chore'
      - 'dependencies'
  default: patch

# Release notes template
template: |
  ## What's Changed
  
  $CHANGES
  
  **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/$OWNER/$REPOSITORY/compare/$PREVIOUS_TAG...v$RESOLVED_VERSION
  
  ---
  
  ### Contributors
  $CONTRIBUTORS

# Autolabeler (optional - automatically adds labels based on branch names or file paths)
